channel.title: Yahoo News - Latest News & Headlines
channel.description: The latest news and headlines from Yahoo! News. Get breaking news stories and in-depth coverage with videos and photos.

item.title: U.S., partners begin airstrikes in Syria
item.description: The U.S. and five Arab countries launch strikes on Islamic State targets in eastern Syria.
item.media:text: The U.S. and five Arab countries launch strikes on Islamic State targets in eastern Syria.

item.title: Israel military shoots down Syrian aircraft
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli military shot down a Syrian fighter jet that infiltrated its airspace over the Golan Heights on Tuesday morning — the first such downing in decades, heightening tensions in the volatile plateau.
item.media:text: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli military shot down a Syrian fighter jet that infiltrated its airspace over the Golan Heights on Tuesday morning — the first such downing in decades, heightening tensions in the volatile plateau.

item.title: U.N. puts spotlight on climate change
item.description: By Valerie Volcovici NEW YORK (Reuters) - With crises from Islamic State to Ebola competing for attention, the United Nations on Tuesday will zero in on climate change, giving leaders from 125 countries a platform to explain how they plan to address the issue. A huge march to call for international action on climate change, which brought as many as 400,000 people to the streets of New York on Sunday, set the tone for the summit spearheaded by U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon. ...
item.media:text: By Valerie Volcovici NEW YORK (Reuters) - With crises from Islamic State to Ebola competing for attention, the United Nations on Tuesday will zero in on climate change, giving leaders from 125 countries a platform to explain how they plan to address the issue. A huge march to call for international action on climate change, which brought as many as 400,000 people to the streets of New York on Sunday, set the tone for the summit spearheaded by U.N. Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon. ...

item.title: Ebola cases to triple in weeks without drastic action: WHO
item.description: Geneva (AFP) - The number of Ebola infections will triple to 20,000 by November, soaring by thousands every week if efforts to stop the outbreak are not stepped up radically, the WHO warned in a study on Tuesday.

item.title: W.H. intruder had 800 rounds of ammo
item.description: Man who scaled fence, entered White House carrying knife was stopped twice before.
item.media:text: Man who scaled fence, entered White House carrying knife was stopped twice before.

item.title: Hamas suspects in slaying of Israeli teens killed
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli special forces stormed a West Bank hideout early on Tuesday and killed two Palestinians suspected in the June abduction and slaying of three Israeli teenagers, a gruesome attack that had triggered a chain of events that led to the war in Gaza this summer.
item.media:text: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli special forces stormed a West Bank hideout early on Tuesday and killed two Palestinians suspected in the June abduction and slaying of three Israeli teenagers, a gruesome attack that had triggered a chain of events that led to the war in Gaza this summer.

item.title: About 100 climate protesters arrested in march on Wall Street
item.description: By Sebastien Malo NEW YORK (Reuters) - About 100 protesters were arrested on Monday in New York City during a demonstration that at one point blocked streets near the stock exchange to denounce what organizers say is Wall Street's contribution to climate change. The demonstration, called Flood Wall Street, drew hundreds of protesters, and came a day after a bigger action that brought 310,000 people to the streets of New York in what activists described as the largest protest ever against climate change. ...
item.media:text: By Sebastien Malo NEW YORK (Reuters) - About 100 protesters were arrested on Monday in New York City during a demonstration that at one point blocked streets near the stock exchange to denounce what organizers say is Wall Street's contribution to climate change. The demonstration, called Flood Wall Street, drew hundreds of protesters, and came a day after a bigger action that brought 310,000 people to the streets of New York in what activists described as the largest protest ever against climate change. ...

item.title: Security heightened at Colorado army base after reports of shots fired
item.description: (Reuters) - A U.S. Army base in Colorado ordered "an increased security presence" on Monday evening after reports of gun shots on or near the base, Fort Carson authorities said in a statement. "This is not thought to be an active shooter event," they added added. The installation near Colorado Springs, about 70 miles south of Denver, said the incident near its northwest perimeter happened at about 7:50 p.m. local time. There were no reports of injuries and an investigation was underway. (Reporting by Eric M. Johnson; Editing by Clarence Fernandez)

item.title: Obama scores coalition victory with Arab strikes
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — For President Barack Obama, the participation of five Arab nations in airstrikes against militants in Syria marked an unexpected foreign policy victory as he plunges the U.S. deeper into a military conflict in the Middle East that he has reluctantly embraced.

item.title: 3 missing Afghan soldiers found at Canadian border
item.description: Soldiers who went missing from a Cape Cod military base over the weekend have been found.
item.media:text: Soldiers who went missing from a Cape Cod military base over the weekend have been found.

item.title: Cops: Bear kills hiker near N.Y.
item.description: A 22-year-old hiker walking with friends in the woods just an hour's drive from New York has been killed by a bear, police said Monday.
item.media:text: A 22-year-old hiker walking with friends in the woods just an hour's drive from New York has been killed by a bear, police said Monday.

item.title: Ebola toll passes 2,800: WHO
item.description: An outbreak of Ebola in West Africa has been largely contained in Senegal and Nigeria, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Monday, but the disease is still spreading elsewhere and has now killed over 2,811 people in the region. Senegal and Nigeria, the most recent of five nations to record cases of Ebola, implemented strict measures to isolate the ill and track down further possible cases -- steps that Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone have failed to impose, allowing the disease to take hold in cities and rural communities. ...
item.media:text: An outbreak of Ebola in West Africa has been largely contained in Senegal and Nigeria, the World Health Organization (WHO) said on Monday, but the disease is still spreading elsewhere and has now killed over 2,811 people in the region. Senegal and Nigeria, the most recent of five nations to record cases of Ebola, implemented strict measures to isolate the ill and track down further possible cases -- steps that Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone have failed to impose, allowing the disease to take hold in cities and rural communities. ...

item.title: American would-be jihadis return home to FBI scrutiny
item.description: An estimated 100 Americans have tried to get to Syria and join up with groups like the Islamic State.
item.media:text: An estimated 100 Americans have tried to get to Syria and join up with groups like the Islamic State.

item.title: Arias trial: Judge maintains camera restrictions
item.description: A judge refused to lift camera coverage restrictions in the penalty phase of Jodi Arias' retrial.
item.media:text: A judge refused to lift camera coverage restrictions in the penalty phase of Jodi Arias' retrial.

item.title: Texas soldier beat daughter to death for soiled diaper, police say
item.description: By Lisa Maria Garza DALLAS (Reuters) - A Fort Bliss, Texas, soldier beat his 2-year-old daughter to death after he became upset that she soiled her diaper, police said on Monday. Dartarious Graham, a 20-year-old U.S. Army specialist, was arrested by El Paso police and charged with capital murder in the death of his daughter. Peyton Graham was found unresponsive with suspicious injuries in her father's apartment and later died at a hospital on Saturday, police said. ...
item.media:text: By Lisa Maria Garza DALLAS (Reuters) - A Fort Bliss, Texas, soldier beat his 2-year-old daughter to death after he became upset that she soiled her diaper, police said on Monday. Dartarious Graham, a 20-year-old U.S. Army specialist, was arrested by El Paso police and charged with capital murder in the death of his daughter. Peyton Graham was found unresponsive with suspicious injuries in her father's apartment and later died at a hospital on Saturday, police said. ...

item.title: Lawyer: Exonerated NYC man dies from asthma attack
item.description: A New York City man freed after serving 23 years in prison for a crime he didn't commit died over the weekend.
item.media:text: A New York City man freed after serving 23 years in prison for a crime he didn't commit died over the weekend.

item.title: NTSB investigating fatal Delaware bus crash
item.description: Vehicle overturned, leaving 2 dead, dozens injured; police say no drugs, alcohol involved.
item.media:text: Vehicle overturned, leaving 2 dead, dozens injured; police say no drugs, alcohol involved.

item.title: Australian jets to join fight against Islamic State
item.description: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Australia's defense minister David Johnston said on Monday during a visit to Baghdad that his country's fighter jets will play a part in U.S.-led air strikes on Islamic State positions in Iraq. Johnston told reporters that up to eight Super Hornet aircraft will participate in a U.S.-led coalition "delivering air strikes to degrade, disrupt and ultimately seek to destroy ISIL (Islamic State)". Australian Special Forces will be serving as advisers to Iraqi forces, Johnston said after a meeting with Iraq's Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi. ...
item.media:text: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Australia's defense minister David Johnston said on Monday during a visit to Baghdad that his country's fighter jets will play a part in U.S.-led air strikes on Islamic State positions in Iraq. Johnston told reporters that up to eight Super Hornet aircraft will participate in a U.S.-led coalition "delivering air strikes to degrade, disrupt and ultimately seek to destroy ISIL (Islamic State)". Australian Special Forces will be serving as advisers to Iraqi forces, Johnston said after a meeting with Iraq's Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi. ...

item.title: Weather may worsen for Calif. wildfires
item.description: Hotter temperatures and erratic winds are expected after a cooler, wet weekend.
item.media:text: Hotter temperatures and erratic winds are expected after a cooler, wet weekend.

item.title: Illinois town's birthday mega-bratwurst and bun
item.description: BELLEVILLE, Ill. (AP) — Residents in the southwest Illinois city of Belleville celebrated its 200th birthday with a 200-foot bratwurst, complete with a 200-foot bun.
item.media:text: BELLEVILLE, Ill. (AP) — Residents in the southwest Illinois city of Belleville celebrated its 200th birthday with a 200-foot bratwurst, complete with a 200-foot bun.

item.title: #FloodWallStreet target NYC's financial district
item.description: Activists to rally against "corporate polluters ...profiting from the fossil fuel industry."
item.media:text: Activists to rally against "corporate polluters ...profiting from the fossil fuel industry."

item.title: Hot property: Apple sets iPhone sales record over weekend
item.description: By Soham Chatterjee (Reuters) - Apple Inc said it sold more than 10 million iPhones in the first weekend after its new models went on sale on Friday, underscoring strong demand for phones with larger displays. Chief Executive Tim Cook said the company could have sold even more iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus models if supplies had been available. Analysts had estimated first-weekend sales of up to 10 million iPhones, after Apple booked record pre-orders of 4 million on Sept. 12, the day pre-orders opened. Apple's shares were little changed at $100.98 in afternoon trading on the Nasdaq on Monday. ...
item.media:text: By Soham Chatterjee (Reuters) - Apple Inc said it sold more than 10 million iPhones in the first weekend after its new models went on sale on Friday, underscoring strong demand for phones with larger displays. Chief Executive Tim Cook said the company could have sold even more iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus models if supplies had been available. Analysts had estimated first-weekend sales of up to 10 million iPhones, after Apple booked record pre-orders of 4 million on Sept. 12, the day pre-orders opened. Apple's shares were little changed at $100.98 in afternoon trading on the Nasdaq on Monday. ...

item.title: Ex-NYC mayor Giuliani joins Activision's 'Call of Duty' legal team
item.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani is joining a video game company's legal fight against disgraced Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega, who is suing Activision over his inclusion in one of its popular "Call of Duty" games.
item.media:text: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani is joining a video game company's legal fight against disgraced Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega, who is suing Activision over his inclusion in one of its popular "Call of Duty" games.

item.title: How did intruder get through White House front door?
item.description: A new surveillance video shows the path taken by the White House intruder on Friday after he hopped the fence, ran across the North Lawn, up the stairs and through the front door before he was stopped.
item.media:text: A new surveillance video shows the path taken by the White House intruder on Friday after he hopped the fence, ran across the North Lawn, up the stairs and through the front door before he was stopped.

item.title: Turkey faces swell of Syrian refugees
item.description: At least 130,000 flee as Islamic State militants seize villages.
item.media:text: At least 130,000 flee as Islamic State militants seize villages.

item.title: Having trouble understanding Common Core? Katie Couric explains
Prosecutor: 800 rounds found in intruder case
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Investigators found more than 800 rounds of ammunition, a machete and two hatchets in the car of the former soldier accused of scaling the White House fence and sprinting inside while carrying a knife, a federal prosecutor said Monday. President Barack Obama was "obviously concerned" about the weekend incident, a spokesman said.

item.title: NASA spacecraft arrives at Mars
item.description: The explorer Maven slips into the red planet's orbit following a 10-month journey.
item.media:text: The explorer Maven slips into the red planet's orbit following a 10-month journey.
